description:
Hi,

When I try to start an instance:
- the instance stays in "pending" state
- I get the following in nova-network.log:
2011-10-28 15:49:56,767 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Attempting to grab semaphore "get_dhcp" for method "_get_dhcp_ip"... from (pid=10448) inner /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:675
2011-10-28 15:49:56,768 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Attempting to grab semaphore "ensure_bridge" for method "ensure_bridge"... from (pid=10448) inner /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:675
2011-10-28 15:49:56,768 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Attempting to grab file lock "ensure_bridge" for method "ensure_bridge"... from (pid=10448) inner /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:680
2011-10-28 15:49:56,768 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): ip link show dev br100 from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:49:56,804 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo ip addr show dev br100 scope global from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:49:56,822 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Attempting to grab semaphore "iptables" for method "apply"... from (pid=10448) inner /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:675
2011-10-28 15:49:56,823 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Attempting to grab file lock "iptables" for method "apply"... from (pid=10448) inner /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:680
2011-10-28 15:49:56,823 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iptables-save -t filter from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:49:56,841 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iptables-restore from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:49:56,874 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Result was 2 from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:183
2011-10-28 15:49:56,874 DEBUG nova.utils [-] ['sudo', 'iptables-restore'] failed. Retrying. from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:197
2011-10-28 15:49:57,665 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iptables-restore from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:49:57,697 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Result was 2 from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:183
2011-10-28 15:49:57,697 DEBUG nova.utils [-] ['sudo', 'iptables-restore'] failed. Retrying. from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:197
2011-10-28 15:49:59,178 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iptables-restore from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:49:59,210 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Result was 2 from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:183
2011-10-28 15:49:59,211 DEBUG nova.utils [-] ['sudo', 'iptables-restore'] failed. Retrying. from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:197
2011-10-28 15:50:00,592 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iptables-restore from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:50:00,623 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Result was 2 from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:183
2011-10-28 15:50:00,624 DEBUG nova.utils [-] ['sudo', 'iptables-restore'] failed. Retrying. from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:197
2011-10-28 15:50:02,125 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iptables-restore from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:50:02,158 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Result was 2 from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:183
2011-10-28 15:50:02,159 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Exception during message handling
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 221, in allocate_for_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     ips = super(FloatingIP, self).allocate_for_instance(context, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 444, in allocate_for_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     requested_networks=requested_networks)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 171, in _allocate_fixed_ips
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     vpn=vpn, address=address)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 1039, in allocate_fixed_ip
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     self._setup_network(context, network)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 1097, in _setup_network
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     network_ref['vpn_private_address'])
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 442, in ensure_vpn_forward
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     iptables_manager.apply()
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py", line 688, in inner
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     retval = f(*args, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 315, in apply
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     attempts=5)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 745, in _execute
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return utils.execute(*cmd, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py", line 191, in execute
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     cmd=' '.join(cmd))
(nova.rpc): TRACE: ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Command: sudo iptables-restore
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Exit code: 2
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Stdout: ''
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Stderr: "iptables-restore v1.4.10: host/network `None' not found\nError occurred at line: 19\nTry `iptables-restore -h' or 'iptables-restore --help' for more information.\n"
(nova.rpc): TRACE: 
2011-10-28 15:50:02,160 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Returning exception Unexpected error while running command.
Command: sudo iptables-restore
Exit code: 2
Stdout: ''
Stderr: "iptables-restore v1.4.10: host/network `None' not found\nError occurred at line: 19\nTry `iptables-restore -h' or 'iptables-restore --help' for more information.\n" to caller
2011-10-28 15:50:02,160 ERROR nova.rpc [-] ['Traceback (most recent call last):\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data\n    rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 221, in allocate_for_instance\n    ips = super(FloatingIP, self).allocate_for_instance(context, **kwargs)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 444, in allocate_for_instance\n    requested_networks=requested_networks)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 171, in _allocate_fixed_ips\n    vpn=vpn, address=address)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 1039, in allocate_fixed_ip\n    self._setup_network(context, network)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 1097, in _setup_network\n    network_ref[\'vpn_private_address\'])\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 442, in ensure_vpn_forward\n    iptables_manager.apply()\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py", line 688, in inner\n    retval = f(*args, **kwargs)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 315, in apply\n    attempts=5)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 745, in _execute\n    return utils.execute(*cmd, **kwargs)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py", line 191, in execute\n    cmd=\' \'.join(cmd))\n', 'ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.\nCommand: sudo iptables-restore\nExit code: 2\nStdout: \'\'\nStderr: "iptables-restore v1.4.10: host/network `None\' not found\\nError occurred at line: 19\\nTry `iptables-restore -h\' or \'iptables-restore --help\' for more information.\\n"\n']

It's possible that I'm not doing everything correctly (it's my first steps with openstack). But it probably shouldn't crash like that anyway.

root@griffon-6:~# dpkg -l |grep nova
ii  nova-api                        2011.3-0ubuntu6.2                       OpenStack Compute - API frontend
ii  nova-common                     2011.3-0ubuntu6.2                       OpenStack Compute - common files
ii  nova-compute                    2011.3-0ubuntu6.2                       OpenStack Compute - compute node
ii  nova-compute-kvm                2011.3-0ubuntu6.2                       OpenStack Compute - compute node (KVM)
ii  nova-doc                        2011.3-0ubuntu6.2                       OpenStack Compute - documetation
ii  nova-network                    2011.3-0ubuntu6.2                       OpenStack Compute - Network manager
ii  nova-objectstore                2011.3-0ubuntu6.2                       OpenStack Compute - object store
ii  nova-scheduler                  2011.3-0ubuntu6.2                       OpenStack Compute - virtual machine scheduler
ii  python-nova                     2011.3-0ubuntu6.2                       OpenStack Compute Python libraries
ii  python-novaclient               2.6.4~bzr112-0ubuntu1                   client library for OpenStack Compute API
title: iptables-restore crashes at instance startup

comments.content:
Hi,

When I try to start an instance:
- the instance stays in "pending" state
- I get the following in nova-network.log:
2011-10-28 15:49:56,767 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Attempting to grab semaphore "get_dhcp" for method "_get_dhcp_ip"... from (pid=10448) inner /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:675
2011-10-28 15:49:56,768 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Attempting to grab semaphore "ensure_bridge" for method "ensure_bridge"... from (pid=10448) inner /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:675
2011-10-28 15:49:56,768 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Attempting to grab file lock "ensure_bridge" for method "ensure_bridge"... from (pid=10448) inner /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:680
2011-10-28 15:49:56,768 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): ip link show dev br100 from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:49:56,804 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo ip addr show dev br100 scope global from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:49:56,822 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Attempting to grab semaphore "iptables" for method "apply"... from (pid=10448) inner /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:675
2011-10-28 15:49:56,823 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Attempting to grab file lock "iptables" for method "apply"... from (pid=10448) inner /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:680
2011-10-28 15:49:56,823 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iptables-save -t filter from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:49:56,841 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Running cmd (subprocess): sudo iptables-restore from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:168
2011-10-28 15:49:56,874 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Result was 2 from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:183
2011-10-28 15:49:56,874 DEBUG nova.utils [-] ['sudo', 'iptables-restore'] failed. Retrying. from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:197

2011-10-28 15:50:02,158 DEBUG nova.utils [-] Result was 2 from (pid=10448) execute /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:183

(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):

(nova.rpc): TRACE:     vpn=vpn, address=address)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 1039, in allocate_fixed_ip
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     self._setup_network(context, network)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 1097, in _setup_network

(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 442, in ensure_vpn_forward
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     iptables_manager.apply()
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py", line 688, in inner
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     retval = f(*args, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 315, in apply
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     attempts=5)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 745, in _execute
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return utils.execute(*cmd, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py", line 191, in execute
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     cmd=' '.join(cmd))
(nova.rpc): TRACE: ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Command: sudo iptables-restore
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Exit code: 2
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Stdout: ''
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Stderr: "iptables-restore v1.4.10: host/network `None' not found\nError occurred at line: 19\nTry `iptables-restore -h' or 'iptables-restore --help' for more information.\n"
(nova.rpc): TRACE: 
2011-10-28 15:50:02,160 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Returning exception Unexpected error while running command.
Command: sudo iptables-restore
Exit code: 2
Stdout: ''
Stderr: "iptables-restore v1.4.10: host/network `None' not found\nError occurred at line: 19\nTry `iptables-restore -h' or 'iptables-restore --help' for more information.\n" to caller
2011-10-28 15:50:02,160 ERROR nova.rpc [-] ['Traceback (most recent call last):\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data\n    rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 221, in allocate_for_instance\n    ips = super(FloatingIP, self).allocate_for_instance(context, **kwargs)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 444, in allocate_for_instance\n    requested_networks=requested_networks)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 171, in _allocate_fixed_ips\n    vpn=vpn, address=address)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 1039, in allocate_fixed_ip\n    self._setup_network(context, network)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 1097, in _setup_network\n    network_ref[\'vpn_private_address\'])\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 442, in ensure_vpn_forward\n    iptables_manager.apply()\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py", line 688, in inner\n    retval = f(*args, **kwargs)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 315, in apply\n    attempts=5)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/linux_net.py", line 745, in _execute\n    return utils.execute(*cmd, **kwargs)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py", line 191, in execute\n    cmd=\' \'.join(cmd))\n', 'ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.\nCommand: sudo iptables-restore\nExit code: 2\nStdout: \'\'\nStderr: "iptables-restore v1.4.10: host/network `None\' not found\\nError occurred at line: 19\\nTry `iptables-restore -h\' or \'iptables-restore --help\' for more information.\\n"\n']

It's possible that I'm not doing everything correctly (it's my first steps with openstack). But it probably shouldn't crash like that anyway.

ii  nova-api                        2011.3-0ubuntu6.2                       OpenStack Compute - API frontend

comments.content:
Hmm, did you create a network (nova-manage network create...) ?
(I agree if that's the reason for failure, it should use a more friendly error message)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: I'm quite sure I did, but I'll try to confirm it
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lucas

comments.content: Setting to invalid until you can confirm... (just set the bug back to new if you can reproduce it)
